io.druid.segment.realtime.plumber

Interface Plumber

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FlushingPlumber, RealtimePlumber

    public interface Plumber

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int add(io.druid.data.input.InputRow row) 
      void finishJob()
      Perform any final processing and clean up after ourselves.
      <T> QueryRunner<T> getQueryRunner(Query<T> query) 
      void persist(Runnable commitRunnable)
      Persist any in-memory indexed data to durable storage.
      void startJob()
      Perform any initial setup.

    • Method Detail

      • startJob

        void startJob()
        Perform any initial setup. Should be called before using any other methods, and should be paired with a corresponding call to finishJob().

      • add

        int add(io.druid.data.input.InputRow row)
        Parameters:
        row - - the row to insert
        Returns:
        - positive numbers indicate how many summarized rows exist in the index for that timestamp, -1 means a row was thrown away because it was too late

      • getQueryRunner

        <T> QueryRunner<T> getQueryRunner(Query<T> query)

      • persist

        void persist(Runnable commitRunnable)
        Persist any in-memory indexed data to durable storage. This may be only somewhat durable, e.g. the machine's local disk.
        Parameters:
        commitRunnable - code to run after persisting data

      • finishJob

        void finishJob()
        Perform any final processing and clean up after ourselves. Should be called after all data has been fed into sinks and persisted.
